meanings.definition: The highest point or top of something.
meanings.sent1: The bird built its nest at the hights of the tree.
meanings.sent2: The flag fluttered proudly at the hights of the pole.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found a cozy spot at the hights of the oak tree.
meanings.sent4: The sun set behind the hights of the mountains, painting the sky in hues of orange.
meanings.sent5: From the hights of the hill, you could see the entire valley below.

meanings.definition: To reach or extend to a great height.
meanings.sent1: The rocket will hights into space soon.
meanings.sent2: The climber aims to hights the summit of the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The balloon unexpectedly hights above the clouds.
meanings.sent4: Her aspirations hights like a soaring eagle in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The skyscraper hights above the city skyline, dominating the view.

meanings.sent1: The castle was perched on the hights overlooking the village.
meanings.sent2: The airplane flew over the hights of the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed the top of the bookshelf as its favorite hights.
meanings.sent4: In the corporate world, reaching the hights of success requires dedication.
meanings.sent5: The hights of the tower offered a breathtaking view of the city below.
